      • setDisplayAnnotations

        public final void setDisplayAnnotations(boolean displayAnnotations)
        If set to true, the chart will show annotations on top of selected values. When this option is set to true, after every numeric column, two optional annotation string columns can be added, one for the annotation title and one for the annotation text.
        Parameters:
        displayAnnotations - default is false

      • setDisplayAnnotationsFilter

        public final void setDisplayAnnotationsFilter(boolean displayAnnotationsFilter)
        If set to true, the chart will display a filter contol to filter annotations. Use this option when there are many annotations.
        Parameters:
        displayAnnotationsFilter - default is false

      • setDisplayDateBarSeparator

        public final void setDisplayDateBarSeparator(boolean displayDateBarSeparator)
        Whether to display a small bar separator ( | ) between the series values and the date in the legend, where true means yes.
        Parameters:
        displayDateBarSeparator - default is true

      • setDisplayExactValues

        public final void setDisplayExactValues(boolean displayExactValues)
        Whether to display a shortened, rounded version of the values on the top of the graph, to save space; false indicates that it may. For example, if set to false, 56123.45 might be displayed as 56.12k.
        Parameters:
        displayExactValues - default is false

      • setDisplayLegendDots

        public final void setDisplayLegendDots(boolean displayLegendDots)
        Whether to display dots next to the values in the legend text, where true means yes.
        Parameters:
        displayLegendDots - default is true

      • setDisplayLegendValues

        public final void setDisplayLegendValues(boolean displayLegendValues)
        Whether to display the highlighted values in the legend, where true means yes.
        Parameters:
        displayLegendValues - default is true

      • setDisplayRangeSelector

        public final void setDisplayRangeSelector(boolean displayRangeSelector)
        Whether to show the zoom range selection area (the area at the bottom of the chart), where false means no. The outline in the zoom selector is a log scale version of the first series in the chart, scaled to fit the height of the zoom selector.
        Parameters:
        displayRangeSelector - default is true

      • setDisplayZoomButtons

        public final void setDisplayZoomButtons(boolean displayZoomButtons)
        Whether to show the zoom buttons ("1d 5d 1m" and so on), where false means no.
        Parameters:
        displayZoomButtons - default is true

      • setFill

        public final void setFill(int fill)
        A number from 0—100 (inclusive) specifying the alpha of the fill below each line in the line graph. 100 means 100% opaque, and 0 means no fill at all. The fill color is the same color as the line above it.
        Parameters:
        fill - default is 0

      • setLegendPosition

        public final void setLegendPosition(ColoredLegendPosition legendPosition)
        Defines where to put the colored legend.
        Parameters:
        legendPosition -

      • setMax

        public final void setMax(double max)
        The maximum value to show on the Y axis. If the maximum data point exceeds this value, this setting will be ignored, and the chart will be adjusted to show the next major tick mark above the maximum data point. This will take precedence over the Y axis maximum determined by scaleType. This is similar to maxValue in core charts.
        Parameters:
        max -

      • setMin

        public final void setMin(double min)
        The minimum value to show on the Y axis. If the minimum data point is less than this value, this setting will be ignored, and the chart will be adjusted to show the next major tick mark below the minimum data point. This will take precedence over the Y axis minimum determined by scaleType. This is similar to minValue in core charts.
        Parameters:
        min -

      • setNumberFormat

        public final void setNumberFormat(int index,
                   String numberFormat)
        Specifies the number format patterns to be used to format the values at the top of the graph. The keys are (zero-based) indexes of series, and the values are the patterns to be used to format the specified series.
        You are not required to include a format for every series on the chart; any unspecified series will use the default format.
        If this option is specified, the displayExactValues option is ignored.
        Parameters:
        index -
        numberFormat -
        See Also:
        java DecimalFormat class

      • setNumberFormat

        public final void setNumberFormat(String numberFormat)
        Specifies the number format pattern to be used to format the values at the top of the graph.
        If this option is specified, the displayExactValues option is ignored.
        Parameters:
        numberFormat -
        See Also:
        java DecimalFormat class

      • setScaleColumns

        public final void setScaleColumns(int... scaleColumns)
        Specifies which values to show on the Y axis tick marks in the graph. The default is to have a single scale on the right side, which applies to both series; but you can have different sides of the graph scaled to different series values.
        This option takes an array of zero to three numbers specifying the (zero-based) index of the series to use as the scale value. Where these values are shown depends on how many values you include in your array:
        • If you specify an empty array, the chart will not show Y values next to the tick marks.
        • If you specify one value, the scale of the indicated series will be displayed on the right side of the chart only.
        • If you specify two values, a the scale for the second series will be added to the right of the chart.
        • If you specify three values, a scale for the third series will be added to the middle of the chart.
        • Any values after the third in the array will be ignored.
        When displaying more than one scale, it is advisable to set the scaleType option to either 'allfixed' or 'allmaximized'.
        Parameters:
        scaleColumns -

      • setScaleFormat

        public final void setScaleFormat(String scaleFormat)
        Number format to be used for the axis tick labels.
        Parameters:
        scaleFormat - default is "#" and displays as an integer.
        See Also:
        java DecimalFormat class

      • setScaleType

        public final void setScaleType(ScaleType scaleType)
        Sets the maximum and minimum values shown on the Y axis.
        Parameters:
        scaleType - default is ScaleType.FIXED

      • setThickness

        public final void setThickness(int thickness)
        A number from 0—10 (inclusive) specifying the thickness of the lines, where 0 is the thinnest.
        Parameters:
        thickness - default is 0
